DisplayName: Ministry of Finance, Economic Development and National Planning
Mandate: Set fiscal policy, manage the national budget, and coordinate multi-sector responses to revenue and security challenges.
TopPriorities: Prioritize expenditures in health, education, and copper royalties while improving budget transparency.
Coordinate with ZRA and the Bank of Zambia to horizon-scan revenue vulnerabilities.
Sustain the public-private dialogue on mining reform launched at the 2025 Copperbelt conference.
ActiveOperations: Budget performance committee that reviews monthly revenue-and-expenditure data shared by ministries and ZRA.
Macro-financial risk cell that models public debt scenarios using data from the Ministry of Mines and the Zambia Chamber of Mines.
Oversight of the Infrastructure Transparency Initiative, which publishes contractor registers online.

RecentActions.Title: Announced tighter disclosures for mining revenue sharing
RecentActions.Summary: The Ministry required all mining companies to report export prices directly to ZRA and the Ministry of Finance, enabling monthly reconciliations.

RecentActions.Title: Launched the Strategic Revenue-Expenditure Outlook
RecentActions.Summary: The cabinet paper linked five-year revenue forecasts to climate-resilient agriculture programs.

KeyPartnerships: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development
